intro: Hexalobus senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese hexalobus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hexagonal seed pods and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Hexalobus senegalensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
